intro: Brachyscome decipiens var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. The hairy bluebell is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a nectar source for pollinators.
